@HentaiCrepes @Tripple-H thanks I'll most certainly check out that doujin of his.

@Tripple-H I deleted the comment for editing purposes but yeah it is his definite best in his new style, but anyways let me repost it "My recommendation read Issen Karuku Tobi Koete, it is the best Post-Suemitsu Dicca so far, it is the part where the masculine works because it still has the appeal of Dicca's Past works and it looks sexy in a way that feels comfortable, I gave that a Strong 8/10." https://nhentai.net/g/125476/

@Tripple-H yeah plot-wise it really made sense why this happened, but it brought at lot of problems along the way, it felt like Dicca regressed instead of improved his new style just made me lose interest on what he would make next.
And just like HentaiCrepes said, go read Issen Karuku Tobi Koete, it's by far my favorite of his works ^^

@HentaiCrepes I think you're entirely right. I can understand from a plot perspective to do a normal yaoi one in the end because that was kinda the whole point why he did all this, but from an artistic perspective it just looks like a waste to me. Suemitsu started this as a really good trap series but now just like you said they got rather masculine and I myself too wasn't really interested in the last ones anymore too.

Magical Insence Vol. 8 is alright but no where near as good as Vol. 2, it lost the appeal of what made Suemitsu such a fantastic artist, (as I considered him back in the day) the concept of the "insense" has almost been stripped away entirely, the artist's shift from the tomgirl sub-genre to the main genre really felt dull (especially the transistion from Vol.4 to Vol.5) the look of the characters look outrageously different (probably because this doujin series has time passage or what not) and even the sex scenes look a bit different granted they are good to look at but in a personal level I find it not to be my cup of tea anymore due to how masculine the trap looks, and yeah that ending is rushed as fuck, the sex positions were the best part, I really liked how instense the shots in page 12 are, but I find the dialogue a bit annoying, so overall I'd say a lukewarm 6/10, personally not my taste but Fujoshis might enjoy this tbh.

Goodness gracious Suemitsu Dicca used to be one of my favorite artists of all time back then, but he suddenly chose to go change the body proportions completely  and mmde his characters look more masculine compared to before, he started off with a promising & consistent line of works specifically Majissu - Magical Incense (which is the first version of this series) and overthere aesthetic-wise everything looked cute and fitting for what your style should be, but then decided to make a remake which granted was kind of great at first but then when Vol. 5 came it just when all out big gay no trap, which really ruined the subtlety he was going for, although sure this looks good for the fujoshi-fans but Suemitsu is a trap-based artist so if you want to switch a genre do it in a way that doesn't feel underwhelming.
